creator: Various
description:
LibriVox recording of Short Nonfiction Collection, Vol. 037 by Various.
Read in English by Garth Burton; Chris Pyle; Winston Tharp; MaryAnn; Bellona Times; Kangaroo692; Will Levine; Rob Board; Availle; Glenn O'Brien; TriciaG; Sue Anderson; progressingamerica
Eighteen short nonfiction works in the public domain, independently chosen by the readers. Topics include the 1906 San Francisco Earthquake, blow-pipe weapons, Oriental china; impressions of America by Enrico Caruso, Oscar Wilde, and Charles W. Eliot; Abraham Lincoln, Frederick Douglass; film directors Ernst Lubitsch and King Vidor; architect Louis Sullivan; Roe vs. Wade, women's rights; microphobia, the Boy Scouts, Kentucky's blue-grass region, and wintry weather.
For further information, including links to online text, reader information, RSS feeds, CD cover or other formats (if available), please go to the LibriVox catalog page for this recording.

For more free audio books or to become a volunteer reader, visit LibriVox.org.
subject: librivox; audiobooks;oscar wilde; Abraham Lincoln; women's rights; motion pictures; Kentucky; San Francisco earthquake; architecture; Boy Scouts; frederick douglass; enrico caruso; oriental china; blow-pipes; blue-grass; microphobia; ernst lubitsch; barack obama; roe v. wade; charles william eliot; lorne w. barclay; king vidor; louis sullivan; office buildings; "form follows function"
